Simulated surface heat fluxes were analysed from 28 AMIP5 and 18 CMIP5 model experiments with suitable diagnostics and several recent Hadley Centre model simulations (see Supplementary Table 1). For AMIP5 and CMIP5, temporal averages over a common simulation period for all models of 1981–2005 inclusive were undertaken. Due to their different run periods, the Hadley Centre stand-alone atmospheric models (consistent with those employed in the coupled models) were averaged over the periods 1978–1995 for HadCM3-A
68 and HadGEM1-A
69 , 1981–2005 for HadGEM2-A
70 (an AMIP5 model); and 1988–2008 for HadGEM3-GC2-A
71 and HadGEM3-GC3.1-A
48 (the Hadley Centre IPCC AMIP6 configuration). Observations and all models were interpolated onto a common HadGEM3-GC3-A N144 grid (a regular latitude-longitude grid with a resolution of approximately 80km at 55 o).
